intro: Jonesiella recedens, commonly known as the slender white stinkweed, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, white to yellow flowers that are often clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. Jonesiella recedens is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is released when the plant is crushed.
